sentences.sContent: Thanks to welfare schemes and unemployment benefits, many of which have their origins in those dark days, joblessness no longer plunges people into destitution, at least in the developed world.
sentences.sContent_eng: Thanks to welfare schemes and unemployment benefits, many of which have their origins in those dark days, joblessness no longer plunges people into destitution, at least in the developed world.
sentences.sCn: 很多福利计划和失业救济金方案都发轫于那些灰暗的失业时期； 受惠于这些计划，至少发达国家的人们不再因为失业而陷入穷困。

remMethod.val: 现在有的研究所 (institution) 很贫穷 (destitution)

trans.tranOther: Destitution is the state of having no money or possessions
